Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2014 08:41PM mscal02 wrote: I just eat what I want. Still within moderation. When I was first diagnosed, I was following a couple of women who had eliminated so much from their diets trying to prolong their lives: I was excited because it seemed so promising. The next thing I knew I was reading about them succumbing to this terrible disease. So, I decided then that I'm not going to deny myself of things I enjoy in this life. When it's my time to go nothing is going to keep me here.

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 01:13PM mscal02 wrote: Hi Haljen: I took taxotere and cytoxan,and did well on it. I did not loose my appetite or have any real bad side effects. I lost my hair everywhere and shaved it at the onset which was around day 14. My DH was there with me during my first treament and expected to have to carry me out. When I woke him up to say let's go he thought my treatment had been cancelled. I was given something for nausea but did not need it. Make sure that he drinks plenty of water and fluids before, during and after treaments, to rinse what he can out of his system.

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2014 11:35AM mscal02 wrote: Hi ChicagoGirl: I've been getting Xgeva since August last year along with Faslodex. I'm still getting Xgeva with Xeloda. I walked a lot and maybe that helped with the fatigue. I would sometimes feel as if I'm going to pass out if I didn't sit down.It's hard to tell which medication is causing what side effects. I do have bone pain  in my legs sometimes, mostly at night when I'm in bed.

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2015 05:19PM mscal02 wrote: nancyh: the hardest part for me is knowing that I'm leaving all my family behind. I had my granddaughters come over today and I gave them Chicken and Dressing cooking lessons so they'll be able to start their own family traditions. One of them said to me, grandma you're acting like you're not going to be around to cook next year. I told her I just want them to learn instead of depending on me to cook it next year.

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2015 12:15PM mscal02 wrote: When I saw my doctor yesterday I asked for a scan because it has been a year . He's not too big on scans and would rather look at the blood work results. When I was checking out I asked if he had put in for me to have a  CT scan and he hadn't .The scheduler told me he probably just wanted to wait until after my next visit and I told her no that wasn't the case and I wanted him contacted . I looked on line at my chart today and it's scheduled for the 25th of this month. I specifically told him I wanted to see what my organs and bones are doing and I wanted him to show me step by step, and not just tell me.
